74 years of service to the 🌍.
17 #GlobalGoals for people & planet.

See how the UN makes a difference in the lives of people everywhere: https://t.co/yrG53kCASH https://t.co/7IBmxnXGa3

Almost 1 in 3 students experience bullying, and a similar proportion are victims of physical violence, finds recent @UNESCO report.

See ways to break the cycle & #EndViolence: https://t.co/MAOfFzV3BE https://t.co/l0l56WLxkh
A very special thank you to all our security colleagues - both furry and human - for keeping us safe all year round. 🐕 https://t.co/9g6kbzqlAx

#YearinReview: In November, @UNICEF Goodwill Ambassadors David Beckham & Millie Bobby Brown joined children at UNHQ in NYC to celebrate World Children's Day and speak up for #ForEveryChild. https://t.co/E53tO8fHvY https://t.co/3iJmCUCR1A

5 tips for a healthy diet in the new year:
☑️ Eat a variety of foods 🥗🥘
☑️ Cut back on 🧂
☑️ Reduce harmful fats & oil 
☑️ Limit sugar 🍬
☑️ Avoid harmful 🍻

@WHO explains how a balanced diet can help lead healthier, longer lives. https://t.co/iOsnDNUqW9 https://t.co/OYGF1gHSR3

Climate adaptation is about
🏠homes
🚜farms
👪communities
🚧roads
👩‍🔧jobs
🍎food
💧water
🏙️cities
💪safety
and P E O P L E.

#ClimateAction now means a stronger & safer future for all. https://t.co/wiiW6huNId via @WBG_Climate https://t.co/A2kYCxs8Ea

As the UN prepares to turn 75, we want to hear your views on how to tackle the big challenges of our time.

Take the #UN75 survey here: https://t.co/jWlwtqFDD5 https://t.co/9BOrlynmAu

From the 2014 Ebola outbreak to the adoption of the #GlobalGoals.

As the decade comes to a close, take a look back at some of the major events that shaped the UN's work around the world.
https://t.co/qPbi5Wp5EY

Loss of wetlands has forced locally endangered fishing cats in Sri Lanka to move into the city, looking for food & survival.

@UNDP supports conservation efforts to protect the wetlands & these wild cats 🐈. https://t.co/q4ffMu34xN

From the first all-woman spacewalk to Sudanese women leading change in the country, take a look back at some of the memorable moments for gender equality in 2019 around the world. #BestOf2019 via @UN_Women
https://t.co/WBqINZT4j9

200,000 of the estimated 4.8 million Venezuelans who left their country amid the ongoing crisis there have sought safety in neighbouring Brazil.

Relocation flights are now giving them a new lease on life.

https://t.co/UXBAuTQ6mV

Next year, 109 million people worldwide, or 1 in 45 people, will be in need of humanitarian assistance.

Here's how you can help: https://t.co/DGX0f4twhD #InvestInHumanity

#YearinReview

The climate emergency is the battle of our lifetime.

One thing is clear: we cannot lose this battle.

-- @antonioguterres talked #ClimateAction in June's issue of @Time. https://t.co/SAxWKLUkpP #BestOf2019 https://t.co/RunRoQZIo9

A lack of info about the number of LGBT people in the labour market is making it difficult to understand the challenges they face in the workplace.

@ILO calls for LGBT labour statistics: https://t.co/cuqKEyxkcx

Everyone has the power to step up for #ClimateAction.

Over half a million people have already started logging their actions to protect our planet & all its people.

Here's how YOU can #ActNow: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/Akf7HHiFR5
.@UNMAS mine clearance experts like 23-year-old Hanan work in Iraq & other countries around the world to clear explosive hazards and protect people. https://t.co/SNq8H5Y6ml https://t.co/eZ2RgCC5Cj

At the end of a tumultuous decade, the number of refugees worldwide has doubled to over 25 million.

See how YOU can help refugees rebuild their lives: https://t.co/FDX7nefwhF 

https://t.co/fBnOE2zuBp

.@iaeaorg promotes the safe, secure & peaceful use of nuclear technologies and helps prevent the spread of nuclear weapons. Find out more: https://t.co/xlYM84Oybd 

https://t.co/inH0SSOHd0

Growing inequalities in everything from housing to healthcare are slowing down progress in creating a sustainable future & achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

More from @UNDP: https://t.co/nTUIGFWJtx 

https://t.co/uQMuOEHLFd

In 2019, @WFP delivered an impressive 3.9 million tonnes of food to hungry people around the world, playing a crucial role to help achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/wXBlYej1z0 #GlobalGoals 

https://t.co/u4urP1yxd6

"This will kill you"

-- In May, Arnold @Schwarzenegger & @antonioguterres talked about the health risks of the climate emergency & why everybody has to take #ClimateAction. https://t.co/b6i5kWzw3H https://t.co/oiEln2zNpr

Are you interested in applying for a job at the UN?

Learn how to create your application, prepare a cover letter & understand the job requirements from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/ilJbrjEYDW https://t.co/clHDyaduBS

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love.

Join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia: https://t.co/Ljui9GqDYQ https://t.co/t1bJHSfapN

Brave women are #ServingForPeace around the 🌎.

Have a look at their photos & personal stories to learn more about their diverse roles in @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/Q5wu7O5sdo https://t.co/jmgFEw3fwE

Education is a basic human right for all children.

@Refugees supports quality education for refugee children everywhere. https://t.co/zFL4eJNvi5 #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/E93XFn43nt

Africa's contributions to greenhouse gas emissions are small, yet the continent experiences many effects of the climate emergency, like floods & drought. 

Find out how YOU can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/xN4WUQllWd

https://t.co/0SffcISksR

15 years after the deadly Indian Ocean tsunami which killed over 230,000 people, the UN's people-centered early warning systems are helping communities to be more resilient to tsunamis. https://t.co/ZxGH7UCWCz #ResilienceForAll https://t.co/a5nZ9HdmFm

.@ILO is celebrating 100 years of promoting social justice around the world through special "Dignity at Work" project documenting the working life of people across the USA.

Meet contemporary beader "Big Chief" in this special report from Louisiana.

https://t.co/6OUv5CMU5E

Next year, 109 million people worldwide, or 1 in 45 people, will be in need of humanitarian assistance. 

Here's how you can help: https://t.co/N5vgtnV8Qu #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/NRiRItVo65

Africa hosts more than 30% of the world’s refugee population, and 3 African countries are among the top 10 refugee-hosting countries.

More facts from @Refugees. https://t.co/Fi8HWUVu0f #WithRefugees https://t.co/hppXtBR35V

40% of plastic produced in the 🌏 is for packaging.

In Cox’s Bazar in Bangladesh, where nearly half a million refugees shop for food, @WFP's stores are replacing plastic with paper. https://t.co/KWIZ4rDNNV #BeatPlasticPollution https://t.co/OTDvKHjKMy
From helping to ensure #HealthForAll to showing that #VaccinesWork in the fight against polio, @WHO shares some of the most important global health stories from the past year. https://t.co/28fbh166Z6
As the decade comes to a close, take a look back at some of the biggest events that shaped the UN's work around the world. https://t.co/rhcBtC3Unj

Conflict, climate-related extreme weather events & health emergencies have left millions of children in need. 

@UNICEF is asking for $4.2 billion to help provide humanitarian assistance to 59 million vulnerable children in 2020. https://t.co/sKFt7O9Fq2 https://t.co/dJeCeAVY6y

#YearinReview

"Right here, right now is where we draw the line. The world is waking up - and change is coming."

-- @GretaThunberg in a powerful address to world leaders at UN #ClimateAction Summit in September. https://t.co/g4uXzT9aRM https://t.co/9Uo63tsVef

Depression can happen to anybody.

It is an illness, not a character weakness - and it can be treated.

Advice from @WHO on how to help those who may be suffering from depression this holiday season: https://t.co/wVrUnST6XR #LetsTalk https://t.co/xfCeaV9IDX

🔸 13% of the global population lacks access to modern electricity.
🔸 3 billion people don't have clean cooking fuels.

The #GlobalGoals aim to ensure all people have access to affordable & sustainable energy by 2030. https://t.co/plMUyKpXpn https://t.co/9AR69bhhxO

People living with HIV are leading the fight against AIDS. 

Communities are among the most effective ways to reach key populations that are most in need of HIV services & treatment. https://t.co/CEfmTHYs2A via @UNAIDS https://t.co/RJKtIuLKeN

Throwback to 2014 when children displaced from their homes by violence and conflict in South Sudan sang Christmas carols in the capital, Juba.

Get details on @UNPeacekeeping's work there from @unmissmedia: https://t.co/QwFV5n8lAK https://t.co/a6x1b4Uj1C

#UNGA Hall featuring a festive display. 

#MerryChristmas to all who are celebrating! https://t.co/OaJCMNY5MC

Syria: Surge in violence in northwest part of the country leads to rise in civilian casualties & displacement.

@UNICEF warns that children are bearing the brunt of the conflict. https://t.co/bac3O3BPYL
A very #MerryChristmas to all our followers celebrating! https://t.co/ffZrEIu0Hd

#YearInReview: From Afghanistan to the Democratic Republic of Congo, @UN_Photo brings us some of the most memorable highlights of 2019 showing the UN's work around the world. https://t.co/yPIVAgyjWC https://t.co/vY51KYFkvI

"In these turbulent and trying times, we must stand together for peace and harmony - and that is the spirit of this season,"

-- @antonioguterres joined @Pontifex in sharing a #Christmas greeting with the world during his visit to the Vatican last week. https://t.co/lPRe56yWj8 https://t.co/SA9aID0bjw

In 2019, @ILO celebrated 100 years of promoting social justice on behalf of people around the world.

From the Great Depression to globalization, see more highlights of its work. #ILO100 https://t.co/h5B2bdjtkd

84% of lone-parent households are led by women, who often juggle paid work, unpaid domestic work, childcare & the care of other family members too. 

@UN_Women has more information on #FamiliesofToday: https://t.co/vVzffsF4LN https://t.co/oTQHVluMEq

#YearInReview

"This is heartbreaking & unacceptable. May these backpacks become a universal symbol of hope & a heartfelt cry for peace."

-@antonioguterres at @UNICEF installation of 3,758 backpacks, each representing a child killed in conflict last year. https://t.co/3PZrzkOlmq https://t.co/mxSQaQJXjd

🌱I am life.
🌱I have been around for longer than you can imagine. 
🌱I am home to millions. 
🌱I cover much of the earth.

Your life relies on mine. I am worth protecting.

I am plants. 🌱🌱

https://t.co/ZWVaWJt1VC via @FAO #PlantHealth https://t.co/SLEjlisJ62
Kenya, Mozambique & Niger have successfully curbed recent polio outbreaks and regained their previous polio-free status. https://t.co/poQpmQ9z68 #VaccinesWork via @WHO https://t.co/Jgm9frKTHZ

Humanitarian aid saved these young girls, but millions more around the world still need your help. 

This holiday season, #InvestInHumanity. https://t.co/JFQ7xhfbcl via @UNOCHA 

https://t.co/pDU3euOp8X

Sustainable food & agricultural systems can reduce food insecurity, help combat the climate emergency & preserve our natural resources.

See how @FAO is leveraging the important links between food, agriculture & our planet. #ZeroHunger https://t.co/46miC7O5sL

Every #ClimateAction counts! Bring your own bag to help reduce waste.

Get more ideas for how you can #ActNow to protect our planet and all its people. https://t.co/0t01OVDMvC https://t.co/tHkFjX4L3k

In many parts of the world, conflict, instability and climate impacts have forced children out of school.

@UNICEF is working to ensure every child is able to access their right to a quality education. https://t.co/BjjlSwCYaK #ForEveryChild https://t.co/vVORVv8NjU

New exhibit at UN Headquarters in NYC explores the impacts of violence against children & encourages concrete action to ensure all children can live free of the fear of violence by 2030. https://t.co/rF8zbklRr7 https://t.co/kc2rYDuYkG

Give the gift of empowerment this holiday season!

Just $10 could help train a women’s rights advocate to work with community leaders in Zimbabwe, Afghanistan or El Salvador.

🎁 https://t.co/9InbEsUqGc via @UN_Women https://t.co/7E9SQextRP

The UN is seeking nominations for the 2020 #MandelaPrize.

For only the second time, the award will honour two individuals for their service to humanity. Details on the prize given in recognition of Madiba's extraordinary legacy. https://t.co/tkrfWWzdgV https://t.co/Pj5IeSyScE

https://t.co/wMpfp9aVlw https://t.co/r2dWVUVHxM

Nearly 1.5 million refugees in more than 60 host countries will hope to be resettled in 2020.

#VaccinesWork: 

40 years ago this month, smallpox, one of the deadliest diseases ever known to humans, was officially eradicated thanks to vaccines. https://t.co/utwegCA7iY via @WHO https://t.co/pC7l8NTiQU

Creating a sustainable #FutureofFood:

@WorldBank offers a menu of solutions to feed nearly 10 billion people by 2050: https://t.co/GMhnoUWngL https://t.co/hA73N11bhh

1 in 3 women around the world have experienced physical or sexual abuse at the hands of their partner.

@WHO has issued new training guidelines aimed at helping healthcare providers support survivors of gender-based violence. https://t.co/XRU9OZrxRa https://t.co/H02XqQLpMK

Hello Kitty is showing her support for the #GlobalGoals around the world!

Venezuela: More than 1 million people have received vital humanitarian aid in the country.

Pope Francis a messenger of hope & dignity, supporting human rights, refugees & migrants, and building bridges between communities.

We need his moral voice more than ever.

-- @antonioguterres on his meeting with @Pontifex. https://t.co/or3AdgNNUW https://t.co/7dbIwtgWVr

@UNOCHA has launched a flash appeal to help those most at risk. https://t.co/Axx48Ev9fF

Harsh weather conditions pose life-threatening risks to children living in remote areas of Jordan.

@UNICEF has distributed winter kits to vulnerable children so they get the warmth and protection they need. https://t.co/DuqL4Cf7AZ #ForEveryChild https://t.co/Wq6Lpenagl

Although the number of migrants who lost their lives declined sharply this year, irregular migration continues to pose serious risks for millions of migrants trying to escape instability & conflict.

-- @antonioguterres after meeting @Pontifex on Friday. https://t.co/or3AdgNNUW https://t.co/MASQlRb9ju

Centered on people & planet, the #GlobalGoals require global cooperation & human solidarity.

On Friday's #SolidarityDay & every day, take action for a better 🌍 https://t.co/qCGnLujSjv https://t.co/7ALCJaN08w

All our challenges have been created by humankind, they can also be solved by us. We have proven that we are able to come together. Let’s rise to the occasion & build a better future for all.

-- @antonioguterres at Italian Senate. https://t.co/snZdGLpL8T https://t.co/qwaf0N9MSt

Do you know a migrant? 

They are 1 in every 30 people in the world.

Wednesday's International #MigrantsDay is an opportunity to celebrate the 272 million migrants that are integral members of the societies in which they live. https://t.co/YWt8jBt6fS #ForMigration https://t.co/E0pSOGEn73

Argentina 🇦🇷

Denmark 🇩🇰 
Morocco 🇲🇦 
Sweden 🇸🇪

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's International #MigrantsDay. https://t.co/Je2zSbAeWf #WeTogether https://t.co/VBrwn5LaGY

Join us in celebrating the language's contribution to global culture: https://t.co/gvZqMNg22U https://t.co/nQGJyki87f

At a time when the right to asylum is under assault, when many borders are closed to refugees, when even child refugees are detained & divided from their families, we need to reaffirm the human rights of refugees.

-- @antonioguterres at #RefugeeForum. https://t.co/1RQpPVKvK0 https://t.co/ahL610xdlv
